一道明亮的光线从你指尖闪过，然后在你选择的范围内绽放，随后以低沉的轰鸣声爆炸成火焰。以那一点为中心的20英尺半径球体范围内的每个生物都必须进行一次敏捷豁免。未通过豁免的目标会受到8d6点火焰伤害，通过豁免的目标则只受到一半伤害。

火焰会在角落蔓延。它会点燃该区域内未被穿戴或携带的易燃物品。

在更高等级时: 当你使用4级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，伤害会随着超过3级的法术位等级增加1d6。

.

Scroll of Hold Person.name: 定身术卷轴(Hold Person)
Scroll of Hold Person.description:
根据你的职业法术列表，如果一个咒语卷轴上写着一个咒语，用一种神秘的密码书写。如果这个咒语在你的职业法术列表上，你可以阅读卷轴并施放其咒语，无需提供任何材料组件。否则，卷轴是无法理解的。通过阅读卷轴施放咒语需要咒语的正常施法时间。一旦咒语被施放，卷轴上的文字会消失，然后它会化为灰尘。如果施法被打断，卷轴不会消失。 如果卷轴上的咒语在你的职业法术列表上，但比你通常可以施放的等级高，你必须进行一次DC 12的能力检定，使用你的施法能力来确定你是否成功施放。检定失败时，咒语会从卷轴上消失，没有其他效果。 卷轴上的咒语等级决定了咒语的豁免检定DC和攻击加值，以及卷轴的稀有度。 【Save DC】: 13 【Attack Bonus】: +5.5em 0px;颜色:rgb(25, 24, 19);字体系列:Signika, sans-serif;字体大小:13px;字体样式:normal;字体变体连字:normal;字体变体大写:normal;字重:400;字母间距:normal;孤行:2;首行缩进:0px;文本转换:none;孤行:2;字间距:0px;-webkit-text-stroke-width:0px;空白:normal;文本装饰厚度:initial;文本装饰样式:initial;文本装饰颜色:initial;文本对齐:起始">巫师卷轴上的巫术可以像法术书中的法术一样被复制。当从巫师卷轴上复制法术时，复制者必须成功通过DC 12的智力(奥术)检定。如果检定成功，法术就被成功复制。无论检定成功与否，卷轴都会被摧毁。

选择一个你能看到的人形目标。目标必须成功通过一次感知豁免才能免疫麻痹状态。在其每个回合结束时，目标可以再次进行一次感知豁免。若成功，法术在目标身上结束。

在更高等级时: 当你使用3级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，你可以额外选择一个人形目标，每个高出2级的法术位等级。这些人形目标在你选择它们时必须相距30英尺。

Second Redbrand's Belt Pouch.name: 第二个红袍团成员的腰包

Shortsword.name: 短剑 (Shortsword)
Shortsword.description: 一把中等大小的刀，带有坚固的十字护手和包裹着皮革的把手。这是一种多功能武器，虽然在射程方面有所不足，但在多功能性方面弥补了这一缺陷。

Spear.name: 长矛(spear)
Spear.description: 一柄坚固的木柄上装有闪亮的钢尖，这支矛可以单手或双手使用，并能以致命的力量穿透最厚重的盔甲。

Talon.name: 爪 (Talon)
Talon.description:
无论是通过恶魔的祝福、天界的赐予、疯狂的实验，还是熟练的工艺，这把武器都被强化，使持有者能够带来更多的杀戮。

这把长剑休息在一个灰尘覆盖的银镶鞘中，刻有“利爪”之名，剑柄形状像一只展翅的猛禽。

你使用这把魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害骰都获得奖励。

Third Redbrand's Belt Pouch.name: 第三个红袍帮的腰包 (Lost Mine of Phandelver)

Well Made Light Crossbow.name: 精良的轻型弩 (Well Made Light Crossbow)
Well Made Light Crossbow.description: 一把小型十字弩，带有木柄和拉紧的弦，能够发射一支单一的弩箭，即使在近距离也能穿透厚重的盔甲。木制部分镶嵌有银。

Well Made Shortsword.name: 精良短剑 (Well Made Shortsword)
Well Made Shortsword.description: 一把中等大小的刀，带有坚固的十字护手和包裹着皮革的把手。这是一种多功能武器，虽然在射程方面有所不足，但在多功能性方面弥补了这一点。它的把柄和护手镶有半宝石。

Censer.name: 熏炉 (Censer)
Censer.description: 在石牙城(goblin shrine)的哥布林神龛(goblin shrine)中发现的一只美丽的香炉(censer)。

Chalice.name: 圣杯
Chalice.description: 在獠牙城堡哥布林神龛中发现的精美制作的圣杯。

Emboldening Brandy.name: 加粗白兰地 (Emboldening Brandy)
Emboldening Brandy.description:
饮下一杯白兰地的角色获得1点临时生命值，但在1小时内饮下两杯或更多的角色将在1小时内患上中毒状态。

一个装满了优质矮人白兰地的小木桶。内含相当于二十杯的量。

Gold Necklace with Emerald Pendant.name: 镶嵌翡翠吊坠的金项链
Gold Necklace with Emerald Pendant.description: 一条镶有精美祖母绿吊坠的金项链。

Golden Elf Statuette.name: 金色精灵雕像 (Golden Elf Statuette)
Golden Elf Statuette.description:
探测魔法(Detect Magic)法术显示，这座小雕像被注入了占卜魔法。一个非邪恶生物握住这座雕像可以向它提问，并接收到一种感应回答，就像生物施放了占卜(Augury)法术一样。一旦一个生物提出问题并得到回答，它就再也无法激活这座雕像了。

一尊精灵的金色雕像，包裹在深红色的布中。

Light Feathered Quarterstaff.name: 轻羽杖 (Light Feathered Quarterstaff).
Light Feathered Quarterstaff.description: 一根包裹着坚固握把的粗木杆，不仅是一种高效的武器，也是一根结实的手杖。这根战杖出奇地轻盈，并雕刻有风格化的羽毛。

Bloody Chain Mail.name: 鲜血锁子甲 (Bloody Chain Mail)
Bloody Chain Mail.description: 由相互锁定的金属环制成，锁子甲包括一层穿在锁子甲下面的夹棉织物，以防止擦伤并缓冲打击的冲击。这套装备包括护手。

Brass Dragon Scales.name: 黄铜龙鳞 (Brass Dragon)
Brass Dragon Scales.description: 一块奇怪的、棕金色的菱形板。每个大约半个人手大小，重量轻，坚硬如铁。

Goblet Set With Moonstones.name: 镶有月光石的高脚杯套装 (Goblet Set With Moonstones)
Goblet Set With Moonstones.description: 在雷树废墟的古塔中发现的镶有月光石的银高脚杯。

Hamun's Chest.name: 哈蒙的宝箱(Hamun's Chest)
Hamun's Chest.description: 在老猫头鹰井(Old Owl Well)的哈蒙·科斯特(Hamun Kost)帐篷内的一个箱子。

Hamun's Tiny Jeweled Box.name: 哈蒙的微型宝石盒(Hamun's Tiny Jeweled Box)

Heavy Crossbow.name: 重型弩 (D&D)
Heavy Crossbow.description: 一把大型十字弩，安装在坚固的木块上，使用手摇曲柄装弹，发射厚重的钢弩箭，具有致命的加速度，可以穿透盔甲和肉体。

Hew.name: 劈击
Hew.description: 无论是通过恶魔的祝福、天界的赐予、疯狂的实验，还是熟练的工艺，这把武器都被强化，使持有者能够带来更多的杀戮。 你使用这把魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害骰获得奖励。 在斧头上用矮人文字母“Hew”拼写的符文，表面的锈迷惑了人。当挥舞者攻击植物生物或木制物体时，“Hew”会造成最大伤害。这把斧头的创造者在森林中砍柴时用它来保护自己。

Old Broken Wooden Chest.name: 破旧的木箱 (D&D)
Old Broken Wooden Chest.description: 在雷树废墟的古老塔楼中发现的破旧木箱，曾被改造成毒牙的巢穴。

Ring of Protection.name: 保护之戒
Ring of Protection.description:
(需要額外附魔)

佩戴此戒指時，你的護甲等級和豁免 throw 會增加+1。佩戴者在試圖避免掉落或被拿走手中物品時，將獲得+4的豁免 throw 或檢定加值。

Sildar's Longsword.name: 西尔达的长剑(Sildar's Longsword)
Sildar's Longsword.description: 一把设计用来砍击敌人的长直刀，长剑是一种非常多才多艺的武器，也可以用双手挥舞，造成更加猛烈的打击。它的剑柄上镶有Neverwinter的标志。

Spell Scroll of Darkness.name: 黑暗(Spell Scroll of Darkness)
Spell Scroll of Darkness.description:
<部分>(秘密)

法术卷轴上写着一条法术的文字，用神秘的密码书写。如果这个法术在你的职业法术列表中，你可以阅读卷轴并施放其中的法术，无需提供任何材料组件。否则，这个卷轴就无法理解。通过阅读卷轴施放法术需要法术的正常施法时间。一旦法术被施放，卷轴上的文字会消失，卷轴会化为灰尘。如果施法被打断，卷轴不会消失。

如果这个法术在你的职业法术列表中，但是比你通常可以施放的等级高，你必须进行一次DC 12的能力检定，使用你的施法能力来确定你是否成功施放。检定失败时，法术从卷轴上消失，没有其他效果。

卷轴上法术的等级决定了法术的豁免DC和攻击加值，以及卷轴的稀有度。

豁免DC: 13
攻击加值: +5.

巫师的法术卷轴上的法术可以像法术书中的法术一样被复制。当从法术卷轴上复制法术时，复制者必须成功进行一次DC 12的智力(奥术)检定。如果检定成功，法术就被成功复制。无论检定成功与否，法术卷轴都会被摧毁。

从你选择的点开始，魔法黑暗会在范围内扩散，填满一个直径15英尺的球体，持续时间内有效。黑暗会绕过角落传播。拥有暗视的生物无法透过这片黑暗看到，非魔法光线也无法照亮它。

如果你选择的点位于你手持的物体上或者不在被穿戴或携带的物体上，黑暗会从物体上散发出来并随之移动。用不透明物体完全遮盖黑暗的源头，比如碗或头盔，可以阻挡黑暗。

如果这个法术的区域与由2级或更低级法术创造的光线区域重叠，创造光线的法术会被驱散。

.

Spell Scroll of Lightning Bolt.name: 闪电箭 (Lightning Bolt) 法术卷轴
Spell Scroll of Lightning Bolt.description:
<部分>(secret)<标识>(secret-t24eex25BxAhLqVl)

法术卷轴上写着一条法术的文字，用一种神秘的密码书写。如果这个法术在你职业的法术列表中，你可以阅读卷轴并施展其中的法术，无需提供任何材料组件。否则，这个卷轴就无法理解。通过阅读卷轴施展法术需要法术的正常施法时间。一旦法术被施展，卷轴上的文字会消失，卷轴会化为灰尘。如果施法被打断，卷轴不会消失。

如果法术在你的职业法术列表中，但是高于你通常可以施展的等级，你必须进行一次DC 12的能力检定，使用你的施法能力来确定你是否成功施展。检定失败时，法术从卷轴上消失，没有其他效果。

卷轴上法术的等级决定了法术的豁免 DC 和攻击加值，以及卷轴的稀有度。

豁免 DC：13
攻击加值：+5。

巫师在咒语卷轴上的咒语可以像在咒语书中一样被复制。当从咒语卷轴上复制咒语时，复制者必须成功进行一次DC 12的智力(奥秘)检定。如果检定成功，咒语将成功被复制。无论检定成功与否，咒语卷轴都会被摧毁。

一道闪电形成一条长100英尺、宽5英尺的直线，从你身上向你选择的方向发射。线上的每个生物都必须进行一次敏捷豁免检定。未通过豁免检定的生物将受到8d6点闪电伤害，通过豁免检定的生物受到一半伤害。

闪电会点燃区域内未被穿戴或携带的易燃物品。

在更高等级时。 当你使用4级或更高级别的法术位施放此咒语时，伤害将每超过3级的位数增加1d6点。

.

Spell Scroll of Misty Step.name: 【迷雾步】(Misty Step)法术卷轴
Spell Scroll of Misty Step.description:
<部分>(secret)<标识>(zwGEQC4VL7f2Yyhv)

法术卷轴上写着一条法术的文字，用神秘的密码书写。如果这个法术在你的职业法术列表中，你可以阅读卷轴并施展其中的法术，无需提供任何材料组件。否则，这个卷轴就无法理解。通过阅读卷轴施展法术需要法术的正常施法时间。一旦法术被施展，卷轴上的文字会消失，卷轴会化为灰尘。如果施法被打断，卷轴不会消失。

如果法术在你的职业法术列表中，但是高于你通常可以施展的等级，你必须进行一次DC 12的能力检定，使用你的施法能力来确定你是否成功施展。检定失败时，法术从卷轴上消失，没有其他效果。

卷轴上法术的等级决定了法术的豁免DC和攻击加值，以及卷轴的稀有度。

豁免DC：13
攻击加值：+5。

巫师卷轴上的巫术可以像法术书中的法术一样被复制。当从巫师卷轴上复制法术时，复制者必须成功进行一次DC 12的智力(奥术)检定。如果检定成功，法术就被成功复制。无论检定成功与否，巫师卷轴都会被摧毁。

被银色薄雾短暂包围，你可以传送至你能看见的未被占据的空间，最远30英尺。

Vial of Perfume.name: 香水瓶 (Vial of Perfume)
Vial of Perfume.description: 一种通常由富人使用的香气商品。

Dragonguard.name: 龙卫军 (Dragonguard)
Dragonguard.description:
穿上这件盔甲时，你的AC获得+1的奖励。

这件胸甲上镶嵌着金龙图案。为了尼华冬古城的英雄泰尔贡而制作，穿戴者对抗龙类的吐息攻击获得优势豁免。

这件盔甲由贴身的金属胸甲和柔软的皮革组成。虽然腿部和手臂相对较为脆弱，但这件盔甲能够保护穿戴者的重要器官，同时又不会使穿戴者行动迟缓。

Lightbringer.name: 光明使者(Lightbringer).
Lightbringer.description:
这件武器，被称为光明使者(Lightbringer)，是为黎明之神拉瑟德(Lathander)的牧师制造的。这把狼牙棒的头部呈太阳爆发形状，由实心黄铜制成。当持有者命令时，这把狼牙棒会发出像火炬一样明亮的光芒。在发光时，这把狼牙棒对不死生物造成额外1d6点伤害。

铸造笔记:额外的1d6伤害可以在“其他”公式中使用。

Spider Staff.name: 蜘蛛法杖(Spider Staff)
Spider Staff.description:
这根黑色的精金法杖顶部呈蜘蛛形状。法杖重6磅。你必须与法杖建立共鸣才能获得它的好处并施放它的咒语。

这根法杖可以用作一根四分之一杖。当用于进行武器攻击时，它会额外造成1d6点毒害伤害。

这根法杖有10个充能，用于激活其中的咒语。手持法杖，你可以使用你的动作从法杖中施放以下咒语之一，如果这个咒语在你的职业咒语列表中：蜘蛛爬行(1充能)或蜘蛛网(2充能，咒语豁免 DC 15)。不需要材料成分。

法杖在每天黄昏时会恢复 [[/r 1d6 + 4]] 个已用充能。如果你耗尽了法杖的最后一个充能，掷出一个 [[/gmroll d20]]。在掷出1的情况下，法杖会化为灰烬并被摧毁。

尼兹纳用蜘蛛法杖发动攻击。

Statue's Emerald Eyes.name: 雕像的翡翠眼 (Statue's Emerald Eyes)
Statue's Emerald Eyes.description: Wave Echo Cave(回音洞)中杜马索因(Dumathoin)雕像的一只翡翠眼。

Black Leather Sack.name: 黑色皮袋
Black Leather Sack.description: 在回声洞穴(Wave Echo Cave)的桌子上发现的一个黑色皮革袋，属于蜘蛛尼兹纳(Nezznar the Spider)。

Dwarven Ale Mug.name: 矮人麦酒杯 (Dwarven Ale Mug)
Dwarven Ale Mug.description: 一只由锤打的电金制成的矮人酒杯(Dwarven ale mug)

Locked Iron Strongbox.name: 锁定的铁制保险箱 (Iron Strongbox)
Locked Iron Strongbox.description: 在回声洞(Wave Echo Cave)发现的一只锁着的铁制保险箱。

Scorched Chest.name: 烧焦的胸膛 (Scorched Chest)
Scorched Chest.description: 在回声洞穴(Wave Echo Cave)发现的一只烧焦的箱子。

Wand of Magic Missiles.name: 魔法飞弹魔杖 (Wand of Magic Missiles)
Wand of Magic Missiles.description:
这根魔杖有7个充能。握持它时，你可以使用一个动作消耗1个或更多的充能，从中施放@Compendium[dnd5e.spells.41JIhpDyM9Anm7cs]{Magic Missile}法术。消耗1个充能时，你施放该法术的1级版本。每额外消耗一个充能，你可以将法术位等级提高一级。

这根魔杖每天黎明时恢复1d6+1个已消耗的充能。如果你消耗了魔杖的最后一个充能，掷一颗d20。结果为1时，魔杖化为灰烬并被摧毁。

Wooden Pipe.name: 木制烟斗(Wooden Pipe)
Wooden Pipe.description: 一根镶有铂金花纹的木烟斗

Bracers of Celerity.name: 迅捷护腕 (Bracers of Celerity)
Bracers of Celerity.description:
奇妙物品，稀有(需要须臾)

这对轻巧的青铜护腕内衬着柔软的紫色天鹅绒，并雕刻着盘旋的图案。

当你戴上这些护腕时，你的所有速度增加10英尺，并且你在进行豁免投掷来避免或结束自身处于&Reference[麻痹]或&Reference[束缚]状态时具有优势。

Decorated Longsword.name: 装饰长剑 (Decorated Longsword)
Decorated Longsword.description: @UUID[典籍.dnd5e.items.Item.10ZP2Bu3vnCuYMIB]{Longsword} 饰有闪闪发光的花纹。

Energized Shard.name: 充能碎片 (D&D)
Energized Shard.description:
覆盖洞穴的虹彩水晶尖塔闪耀着魔法能量。

可用作施法焦点。

Iron Ingot.name: 铁锭
Iron Ingot.description: 通常是金属工人的得力助手，铁因其相对丰富和易获取而受到赞赏。 表面铁可以从陨石和异物中找到，但更常见的是在地下开采。 但是，必须小心，否则锈蚀会造成损失。

Javelin of Lightning.name: 闪电标枪(Javelin of Lightning).
Javelin of Lightning.description: 金尖闪电标枪 这支标枪是一件魔法武器。当你投掷它并说出它的口令后，它会变成一道闪电，形成一条宽5英尺的线，从你延伸到120英尺内的目标。线上除了你和目标之外的每个生物必须进行一次DC 13的敏捷豁免，未通过者会受到4d6点闪电伤害，通过者受到一半伤害。当闪电抵达目标时，它会重新变回标枪。对目标进行远程武器攻击。命中后，目标会受到标枪伤害加上4d6点闪电伤害。 这支标枪的特性直到第二天黎明前无法再次使用。在此期间，这支标枪仍然可以作为一件魔法武器。

Luminous Daylight.name: 明亮白昼 (Luminous Daylight)
Luminous Daylight.description:
从你选择的战锤上的一个点开始，一团半径为60英尺的光亮球体扩散开来。这个球体是明亮的光线，再额外投射出60英尺的暗淡光线。

如果你选择了你手持的物体上的一个点，或者一个没有被穿戴或携带的物体上的一个点，光线将从物体上发出并随物体移动。完全用不透明的物体，比如碗或头盔，覆盖受影响的物体会阻挡光线。

如果这个法术的区域与由3级或更低级法术创造的黑暗区域重叠，那么创造黑暗的法术将被驱散。

Luminous War Pick.name: 发光战锤(Luminous War Pick)
Luminous War Pick.description:
武器 (战锤), 稀有 (需要须持有)

这把战锤的柄镶嵌着碎珍珠石，赋予武器微弱的发光。你使用这把战锤进行的攻击和伤害骰获得+1的奖励。

持握这把战锤时，你可以使用一个奖励动作施放@UUID[Item.s9ZNjlUlDN5fztnW]{daylight}法术，选择战锤上的一个点。一旦你使用了这个奖励动作，直到次日黎明前都不能再次使用。

Ring of Mind Shielding.name: 心灵屏障戒指 (Ring of Mind Shielding)
Ring of Mind Shielding.description:
(需要进行须臾)

佩戴这枚戒指时，你对允许其他生物读取你的思维、判断你是否说谎、了解你的阵营或了解你的生物类型的魔法免疫。只有在你允许的情况下，生物才能与你进行心灵感应交流。

你可以使用一个动作使戒指变得隐形，直到你使用另一个动作使其可见，直到你取下戒指，或者直到你死亡。

如果你在佩戴戒指时死亡，你的灵魂会进入其中，除非它已经寄宿了一个灵魂。你可以留在戒指中，也可以前往来世。只要你的灵魂在戒指中，你可以与任何佩戴它的生物进行心灵感应交流。佩戴者无法阻止这种心灵感应交流。

Silver Bracers of Archery.name: 银弓臂铠 (of Archery)
Silver Bracers of Archery.description:
神奇物品，(需要灵机)

一套精致的银质射箭护腕

佩戴这些护腕时，你对长弓和短弓有熟练加值，并且你在使用这些武器进行远程攻击时，伤害骰获得+2的加值。

Unrefined Iron Ore.name: 未精炼的铁矿石 (Iron Ore)
Unrefined Iron Ore.description: 这种未经精炼的矿石三十磅足以供应一个熟练的铁匠制作出价值25 gp的@UUID[Item.IoJIJdOLKSpminMe]{seven iron ingots}。

Dagger of Venom.name: 毒液匕首
Dagger of Venom.description:
你使用这把魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害骰获得+1的奖励。

你可以使用一个动作让这把匕首涂上浓稠的黑色毒液。毒液会持续1分钟，或者直到使用这把武器进行的攻击命中生物。那个生物必须通过一次DC 15的体质豁免才能免受2d10点毒性伤害，并且中毒1分钟。直到次日黎明前，这把匕首无法再次这样使用。

Deurgar Tapestry.name: 德尔加挂毯 (Deurgar Tapestry)
Deurgar Tapestry.description: 丰富编织但布满灰尘的灰暗矮人挂毯

Emerald Elemental Gem.name: 翡翠元素宝石 (Emerald Elemental Gem)
Emerald Elemental Gem.description:
奇妙物品

这颗翡翠宝石中蕴含着一点元素能量。当你使用一个动作打破这颗宝石时，一个如同你施放了@Compendium[dnd5e.spells.1LkZvINag7KqBmDR]{Conjure Elemental}法术的@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.namJz755U1EhvEJa]{Water Elemental}被召唤出来，而宝石的魔法也会消失。

Gem of Brightness.name: 明亮宝石(Gem of Brightness)
Gem of Brightness.description:
奇妙物品

这个棱镜有50个充能。当你握着它时，你可以使用一个动作来说出三个口令中的一个，从而产生以下效果之一：

  • 第一个口令让宝石在30英尺半径内散发明亮光，额外的30英尺内散发微光。这个效果不消耗充能。它持续直到你使用一个奖励动作重复口令，或者使用宝石的其他功能。
  • 第二个口令消耗1个充能，让宝石向你能看到的60英尺内的一只生物发射一道耀眼的光束。该生物必须通过一次DC 15的体质豁免才能避免在1分钟内失明。生物可以在每个回合结束时重复豁免才能，成功则结束自身的效果。
  • 第三个口令消耗5个充能，让宝石在自身发出的30英尺锥形区域内闪耀着致盲的光芒。锥形区域内的每个生物都必须进行豁免检定，就像被第二个口令创造的光束击中一样。

当宝石的所有充能用尽时，宝石变成一颗价值50金币的非魔法宝石。

Potion of Greater Healing.name: 强效治疗药水 (Potion of Greater Healing)
Potion of Greater Healing.description:
药水的红色液体在搅动时闪闪发光。

当你喝下这瓶药水时，你会恢复4d4+4点生命值。

Potion of Psionic Fortitude.name: 灵能坚韧药剂(Potion of Psionic Fortitude)
Potion of Psionic Fortitude.description:
药水(Uncommon)

当你喝下这瓶药水时，在接下来的1小时内，你在避免或结束自身被魅惑或眩晕状态的豁免投掷中获得优势。

这瓶黑色药水中缭绕着闪闪发光的粉紫色小片。

Rooftop Stash.name: 屋顶藏匿
Rooftop Stash.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoStolenShards.JournalEntryPage.MlI6kpy3oKLDKy6m]{Rooftop Stash.}

包含了酒馆大部分的周收入。

Three Sealed Crates.name: 三个封闭的板条箱 (D&D)
Three Sealed Crates.description:
在@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoZorzulasRest.JournalEntryPage.xc8QtXYkMu6R60NN]{Z18.}中找到

每个板条箱可以通过成功的[[/check skill=ath dc=12]]检定来撬开。

Alchemy Jug.name: 炼金壶 (Alchemy Jug)
Alchemy Jug.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6talhunder.JournalEntryPage.7yykJG22FtRRTJmV]{T11.}

神奇物品

这个陶瓷罐看起来可以容纳一加仑液体，无论满还是空，重量都是12磅。即使罐子是空的，摇晃时也可以听到里面传来的声音。

你可以使用一个动作，从下表中选择一种液体的名字，使罐子产生所选的液体。之后，你可以作为一个动作拔开瓶塞，每分钟最多倒出2加仑的液体。罐子可以产生的液体的最大量取决于你命名的液体。

一旦罐子开始产生一种液体，直到第二天黎明之前，它就不能产生不同的液体，或者超过其最大量。

液体

最大量

酸

8盎司

基础毒药

1/2盎司

啤酒

4加仑

蜂蜜

1加仑

蛋黄酱

2加仑

油

1夸脱

醋

2加仑

淡水

8加仑

盐水

12加仑

葡萄酒

1加仑

Bead of Force.name: 力量珠 (Bead of Force)
Bead of Force.description:
奇妙物品

这个小黑色球直径为3/4英寸，重量为一盎司。通常，会一起找到1d4 + 4颗力量珠。

你可以使用一个动作将珠子扔出60英尺。珠子着地时爆炸并被摧毁。在珠子着陆点周围10英尺半径范围内的每个生物必须通过一次DC 15的敏捷豁免才能免受5d4力量伤害。然后，一个透明力场球将封闭该区域1分钟。任何在该区域内完全失败豁免的生物都被困在这个球体内。成功通过豁免的生物，或者部分在该区域内的生物，将被推离球体中心，直到他们不再在内。只有可呼吸的空气可以穿过球体的墙壁。没有攻击或其他效果可以。

被封闭的生物可以使用动作推开球体的墙壁，将球体移动到生物步行速度的一半。球体可以被拾起，它的魔法使其重量只有1磅，无论内部生物的重量如何。

Blessing of Dumathoin.name: 杜马索因的祝福
Blessing of Dumathoin.description:
你的眼睛变得敏锐，足以发现隐藏的秘密。你获得 &Reference[darkvision](暗视)。如果你已经拥有暗视，你可以在黑暗中看到彩色。

此外，你可以使用一个动作，在1分钟内获得 &Reference[truesight](真视)。一旦以这种方式获得真视，你必须完成一次长休才能再次这样做。

Collapsible Cage.name: 可折叠笼(Collapsible Cage)
Collapsible Cage.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6gibbetcro.JournalEntryPage.y37U98syx1IS7rV4]{G3.}

它可以在1分钟内被折叠平放。重量为50磅。尽管笼子的大部分部分是铁制的，但它有由秘银制成的加固条和铰链，以及向内尖锐的尖刺。笼子没有锁；顾客需要额外支付购买其他地方制造的锁。

Funerary Armor.name: 殡葬盔甲 (Funerary Armor)
Funerary Armor.description:
由于这套盔甲是为塔尔亨德(Talhund)的葬礼而制作的板甲，杜玛索因(Dumathoin)的信徒们不愿攻击穿戴者。

塔尔亨德之墓(Crypt of the Talhund)中的不死矮人对任何穿戴这套盔甲的人进行攻击时有劣势。

Immovable Greataxe.name: 不动巨斧 (Immovable Greataxe)
Immovable Greataxe.description:
这把巨斧并非魔法物品，但它的柄上有一个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.eQNXan0zp279jDtk]{immovable rod}。控制这根杆的按钮对于使用这把巨斧的任何人来说都很容易触及。

你可以使用一个动作按下按钮，这会使巨斧在魔法作用下固定在原地。直到你或另一个生物再次使用一个动作按下按钮，这把斧头都不会移动，即使它违背了重力。这把斧头可以承受高达8,000磅的重量。超过这个重量会导致斧头失效并掉落。生物可以使用一个动作进行[[/check ability=str dc=30]]检定，成功后可以将固定的斧头移动最多10英尺。

Large Collapsable Cage.name: 大型可折叠笼(Large Collapsable Cage)
Large Collapsable Cage.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6gibbetcro.JournalEntryPage.xXHsGkGDLo7YqHpD]{G6.}

它可以在2分钟内折叠平放。重量为500磅，适合大型生物使用。尽管笼子的大部分由铁制成，但加固条和铰链由秘银制成，并且有向内尖锐的尖刺。笼子没有锁；顾客需要额外支付制造在别处的锁。

Marthungrim's Journal.name: 马斯格林的日记。
Marthungrim's Journal.description:
在一个矮人骷髅和杜马索因神龛附近发现，里面包含以下信息：
Marthungrim是杜马索因的圣骑士，60年前多挖掘了这个住所。杜马索因委托Marthungrim将灵魂归于安宁，当一个为神忠诚的地下室被腐化时。

Marthungrim发现地下室位于一个名为Talhundereth的神庙下面，但神庙里满是危险的怪物。地下室由一个锁保护，锁上有一个谜题，杜马索因的信徒比其他人更容易解开。(谜题的答案没有包含在日记中。)

Marthungrim计划摧毁在地下室中游荡的不安灵魂，让他们得以安息。

被一种他描述为“滚动的触手堆”的生物重伤后，Marthungrim返回到这里。他的最后一篇记录描述了他的伤势变得更加严重。

Obelisk Fragment.name: 方尖碑碎片 (Obelisk Fragment)
Obelisk Fragment.description: 这些碎片比方达林(Phandalin)的碎片更大，重达50磅，边长超过一英尺。这些碎片被超自然力量硬化，无法被任何手段损坏。

Periapt of Health.name: 健康护身符(Periapt of Health)
Periapt of Health.description:
神奇物品

佩戴这个吊坠时，你免疫任何疾病。如果你已经感染了疾病，佩戴吊坠时疾病的影响会被抑制。

Ring of the Orator.name: 演说者之戒
Ring of the Orator.description:
戒指, 罕见的(需要须熟练)

这枚戒指有6个充能。当你佩戴它时，你可以消耗1个充能，将你的声音投射出去，让所有在你周围1英里范围内的生物清晰地听到，无论中间有多少噪音，持续1分钟。魔法的寂静、1英尺的石头、1英寸的普通金属、一张薄铅片或3英尺的木头会阻挡这种投射。如果你用一种听众不懂的语言投射你的声音，你可以让这些生物理解你在说什么。你必须能看见这些生物才能让它们理解。这枚戒指每天在黎明时恢复1d6个已消耗的充能。

The Granite Ledger.name: 花岗岩账本 (The Granite Ledger)
The Granite Ledger.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6talhunder.JournalEntryPage.IzrwA51W0euRYVZh]{T16.}

内含金属页和由薄花岗岩板制成的封面。这本书是花岗岩分类账，收录了塔尔亨德雷斯的秘密。

Book.name: 书籍
Book.description: 未使用的书籍，内页是空白的。

Calligrapher's Supplies.name: 书法家用具
Calligrapher's Supplies.description:
这些特殊工具包括在书法工艺或行业中追求所需的物品。

熟练掌握一套工匠工具可以让你在使用该工具进行工艺时，将你的熟练加值加到任何相关能力检定中。每种类型的工匠工具需要单独的熟练加值。

Cartographer's Tools.name: 制图工具 (Cartographer's Tools)
Cartographer's Tools.description:
这些特殊工具包括从事制图工艺或贸易所需的物品。

熟练使用一套工匠工具可以让你在使用该工具进行工艺时，将你的熟练加值加到任何能力检定上。每种类型的工匠工具都需要单独的熟练。

Drow Vault Valuables.name: 黑暗精灵地下宝库财宝

Eyes of Minute Seeing.name: 微观视觉之眼
Eyes of Minute Seeing.description:
奇妙物品

这些水晶透镜可以戴在眼睛上。戴上它们后，你可以在1英尺范围内比平常看得更清楚。在搜索区域或研究该范围内的物体时，依赖视觉的&Reference[investigation]检查获得优势。

Heward's Handy Haversack.name: 休沃德的便携袋(Heward's Handy Haversack)
Heward's Handy Haversack.description:
奇妙物品

这个背包有一个中央袋和两个侧袋，每个都是一个超维空间。每个侧袋可以容纳最多20磅的材料，不超过2立方英尺的体积。大中央袋可以容纳最多8立方英尺或80磅的材料。无论内容如何，背包的重量始终为5磅。

将物品放入魔袋遵循与物品互动的正常规则。从魔袋中取出物品需要使用一个动作。当你伸手进魔袋寻找特定物品时，该物品总是神奇地位于顶部。

魔袋有一些限制。如果超载，或者尖锐物体刺穿或撕裂它，魔袋会破裂并被摧毁。如果魔袋被摧毁，其中的内容将永远丢失，尽管神器总会再次出现。如果魔袋被掀转内外，其中的内容会溢出，不受损害，必须将魔袋恢复正常才能再次使用。如果将一个呼吸生物放入魔袋，该生物可以在其中存活最多10分钟，之后开始窒息。

将魔袋放入由一个袋子、便携空间或类似物品创建的超维空间中会立即摧毁两个物品，并打开通往星界平面的门。门的起源是一个物品放入另一个物品的位置。任何在门口10英尺范围内的生物都会被吸入其中，并被传送到星界平面上的随机位置。然后门关闭。门是单向的，无法重新打开。

Holy Symbol of Dumathoin.name: 杜马索因神圣符号
Holy Symbol of Dumathoin.description:
一枚铂金圣徽 (Dumathoin)

施法聚焦。牧师或圣骑士可以将圣徽作为施法聚焦。要以这种方式使用符号，施法者必须手持它，明显佩戴它，或者将它挂在盾牌上。

Illustrated Book on Ropers.name: 《触手怪图鉴》
Illustrated Book on Ropers.description: 一本包含历史记载、特定领域知识、神话或传说的书籍 (lore)。

Jeweled Dagger.name: 宝石匕首 (Jeweled Dagger)
Jeweled Dagger.description: 一把短金属刀片安装在一个小把手和十字护手上。匕首对于坚韧的战士来说是一种有效的副武器，对于刺客和小偷来说是一种隐藏的利刃。

Lantern of Revealing.name: 揭示之灯 (Lantern of Revealing)
Lantern of Revealing.description:
奇妙物品

这个罩灯在点燃时，可以用1品脱油燃烧6小时，照亮30英尺半径范围内的明亮光线，另外30英尺范围内的昏暗光线。只要处于灯笼的明亮光线中，隐形生物和物体都是可见的。你可以使用一个动作将灯罩降低，将光线减弱到5英尺半径范围内的昏暗光线。

Mindguard Crown.name: 心灵守护者王冠(Mindguard Crown)
Mindguard Crown.description:
奇妙物品，极其稀有(需要须臾)

当你戴上这顶精钢王冠时，你在智力、感知和魅力豁免检定上获得优势，并且对精神伤害具有抗性。

Mudslick Tower.name: 泥滑塔(Mudslick Tower)
Mudslick Tower.description:
奇妙物品，极其稀有

你可以使用一个动作将这个直径1英寸的花岗岩球放在地面上，并说出它的命令词，即在地精语中为“石化”。这个球迅速长成一座坚固的塔，直到你使用一个动作触摸这座塔并再次说出命令词，此时塔会缩小回一个直径为1英寸的花岗岩球。这座塔必须是空的才能以这种方式缩小。这座塔上长满了泥泞的疙瘩，这些疙瘩不断地在表面伸缩，就像塔通过一层厚厚的泥浆呼吸一样。

在塔出现的区域内的每个生物必须进行一次DC 15的敏捷豁免检定，豁免失败则受到10d10的钝击伤害，豁免成功则受到一半伤害。无论哪种情况，生物都会被推到塔外但靠近塔的一个空位。区域内未被穿戴或携带的物体也会受到这个伤害并被自动推开。

每当它扩张时，泥泞塔会与其接触的任何天然石材融合，笨拙地倾斜和卡住自己以尽可能接触更多的天然石材。

这座塔的一侧有一个小门，只有在你的命令下才会打开，你可以将其作为一个奖励动作说出。它对于《敲击》法术和类似的魔法，比如《开启的风铃》都具有免疫力。

尽管看起来像石头，但这座塔是由精金制成的，它的魔法防止生物将其推倒。屋顶、门和墙壁各自有100点生命值，免疫来自非魔法武器(不包括攻城武器)的伤害，并对所有其他伤害具有抗性。与天然石材融合时，泥泞塔对所有伤害免疫。只有一次愿望法术才能修复这座塔(这次使用法术相当于复制8级或更低级的法术)。每次施放愿望法术都会使屋顶、门或一面墙恢复50点生命值。

Potion of Invulnerability.name: 无敌药水 (Potion of Invulnerability)
Potion of Invulnerability.description: 在你喝下这瓶药剂后的1分钟内，你对所有伤害具有伤害抗性。这瓶药剂的糖浆般的液体看起来像液态铁。

Shrine Contents.name: 神龛内容
Shrine Contents.description:
发现在@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6gibbetcro.JournalEntryPage.xGHA4cO1EB5uejZp]{G20.}

爬行在网中的蜘蛛是由约克洛尔(yochlol)施加魔法的平凡硬币。如果从这个房间移走，它们会恢复成普通的硬币。

Silk Rope (50 ft.).name: 丝绳 (50英尺)
Silk Rope (50 ft.).description: 无论是大麻还是丝绳，都有2点生命值，并且可以通过一次DC 17的力量检定来破裂。

Silver Medallion.name: 银质勋章 (Silver Medallion)
Silver Medallion.description: 一枚银质勋章，上面雕刻着一只蜥蜴头部，后面有一支羽毛笔。

Spell Scroll: Freedom of Movement.name: 法术卷轴：自由行动(Freedom of Movement)
Spell Scroll: Freedom of Movement.description:
一个法术卷轴上写着一条法术，用神秘的密码书写着。如果这个法术在你的职业法术列表中，你可以阅读卷轴并施放其法术，无需提供任何材料组件。否则，卷轴是无法理解的。通过阅读卷轴施放法术需要法术的正常施法时间。一旦法术被施放，卷轴上的文字会消失，然后它会化为尘埃。如果施法被打断，卷轴不会消失。

自由行动 (4级)

你触摸一个愿意的生物。在持续时间内，目标的移动不受复杂地形的影响，法术和其他魔法效果既不能减少目标的速度，也不能使目标瘫痪或束缚。

目标还可以花费5英尺的移动来自动摆脱非魔法束缚，比如手铐或者一个抓住它的生物。最后，在水下不会对目标的移动或攻击造成任何惩罚。

卷轴详情

如果卷轴上的法术在你的职业法术列表中，但比你通常可以施放的级别高，你必须进行一次DC 14的能力检定，使用你的施法能力来确定你是否成功施放。检定失败，法术会从卷轴上消失，没有其他效果。

卷轴上法术的级别决定了法术的豁免 DC 和攻击加值，以及卷轴的稀有度。

豁免 DC: 15
攻击加值: +7。

法师卷轴上的法术可以像法术书中的法术一样被复制。当从法术卷轴中复制法术时，复制者必须成功进行一次DC 14的智力(奥术)检定。如果检定成功，法术就成功被复制。无论检定成功与否，法术卷轴都会被摧毁。

Talhundereth Vault Hoard.name: 塔尔亨德雷斯宝库(Talhundereth Vault Hoard)
Talhundereth Vault Hoard.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6talhunder.JournalEntryPage.Hwdi76jYAGZPJ8Gp]{T8.}

藏品包括510pp，1,250gp，以及以下物品：

  • 十二颗价值100gp的各种小宝石

  • 一枚价值150gp的杜马托因白金圣徽

  • 三座价值400gp的矮人战士黄金雕像

  • 一瓶无敌药水

  • 一双微观视力之眼

Thieves' Tools.name: 盗贼工具 (Thieves' Tools)
Thieves' Tools.description: 这套工具包括一个小锉刀、一套开锁工具、一个安装在金属把手上的小镜子、一套窄刃剪刀和一把钳子。熟练使用这些工具可以让你在解除陷阱或开锁时，将你的熟练加值加到任何相关技能检定中。

Wand of Magic Detection.name: 魔法侦测魔杖 (Wand of Magic Detection)
Wand of Magic Detection.description: 这根魔杖有3个充能。握持它时，你可以将1个充能作为一个动作来施放@Compendium[dnd5e.spells.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{Detect Magic}法术。这根魔杖每天黎明时会恢复1d3个已用充能。

Crypt Guardian.name: 地穴守护者 (Crypt Guardian)
Crypt Guardian.description:
墓穴守护者使用@UUID[Actor.pbsoRevenant0000]{revenant}的属性块，并进行以下更改：

  • 他们只会说矮人语。
  • 他们誓言要向所有入侵墓穴的生者复仇。
  • 如果角色们已经平息了墓穴的幽灵(参见@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6crypttalh.JournalEntryPage.4WGf0GMNYJlIPjmd#purifying-the-crypt]{Purifying the Crypt}部分)，他们将不会再恢复活力。

Spellcasting (Psionics).name: 施法(超能力)
Spellcasting (Psionics).description:
施法(超能力)。藤蔓怪物施展以下其中一个法术，无需材料成分，以智力作为其施法能力值(法术豁免 DC 8)：

随意使用：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oIzA2MEHwxhtQneU]{minor illusion}

每日1次：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.eS7XnnApoxRxYXPs]{charm person}(已施展)

Careful Mind Crystal.name: 谨慎心晶 (Careful Mind Crystal).
Careful Mind Crystal.description:
奇妙物品，罕见(Uncommon)

这些宝石包含了结晶化的施法魔法。存在不同类型的心智水晶，每种都具有不同的一次性效果。

当你持有一颗心智水晶施放施法时间为1个行动的法术时，你可以以特定方式修改法术，具体效果如下所述。你只能使用一颗心智水晶来修改法术，不能在同一个法术上同时使用心智水晶和元术选项。一旦你使用了心智水晶，它就变成一颗价值50gp的非魔法宝石。

效果。选择最多三个受法术影响的生物。被选择的生物自动成功通过对该法术的豁免检定。

Distant Mind Crystal.name: 遥远心智水晶 (Distant Mind Crystal)
Distant Mind Crystal.description:
奇妙物品，罕见

这些宝石包含了结晶化的一点施法魔法。存在不同类型的心智水晶，每种都具有不同的一次性效果。

当你持有一颗心智水晶施放施法时间为1个行动的法术时，你可以以特定方式修改法术，具体效果如下所述。你只能使用一颗心智水晶来修改法术，不能在同一个法术上同时使用心智水晶和元术选项。一旦你使用了心智水晶，它就变成一颗价值50gp的非魔法宝石。

效果。如果法术的射程为5英尺或更远，并且不是自身范围，法术的射程增加100英尺。如果法术的射程为触摸，则其射程变为30英尺。

Empowered Mind Crystal.name: 强化心智水晶 (Empowered Mind Crystal)
Empowered Mind Crystal.description:
奇妙物品，罕见

这些宝石包含了结晶化的施法魔法。存在不同类型的心智水晶，每种都具有不同的一次性效果。

当你持有一颗心智水晶施放施法时间为1个行动的法术时，你可以以特定方式修改法术，具体效果如下所述。你只能使用一颗心智水晶来修改法术，不能在同一个法术上同时使用心智水晶和元法术选项。一旦你使用了心智水晶，它就变成一颗价值50gp的非魔法宝石。

效果。当你掷骰法术伤害时，你可以重新掷最多三个伤害骰。你必须使用新的点数。

Extended Mind Crystal.name: 扩展心智水晶 (Extended Mind Crystal)
Extended Mind Crystal.description:
奇妙物品，罕见

这些宝石包含了结晶化的施法魔法。存在不同类型的心智水晶，每种都具有不同的单次使用效果。

当你持有一颗心智水晶施放施法时间为1个行动的法术时，你可以以特定方式修改法术，具有下面描述的效果。你只能使用一颗心智水晶来修改法术，不能在同一个法术上同时使用心智水晶和元术选项。一旦你使用了心智水晶，它就变成一颗价值50金币的非魔法宝石。

效果。如果法术的持续时间为1分钟或更长，将法术的持续时间加倍，最长持续时间为24小时。

Gnawble.name: 啮咬兽
Gnawble.description:
查看@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh7rifts0000.JournalEntryPage.Amm4kRqrWbHTf56Y#gnawbles]{Gnawbles (Far Realm Rifts Features)}以获取更多信息。

这个毛茸茸的球体巴掌大小，上面有一张带着尖牙的嘴。

Heightened Mind Crystal.name: 提升思维水晶 (Heightened Mind Crystal)
Heightened Mind Crystal.description:
奇妙物品(Rare)

这些宝石包含了结晶化的施法魔法。存在不同类型的心智水晶，每种都具有不同的一次性效果。

当你持有一块心智水晶施放施法时间为1个行动的法术时，你可以以特定方式修改法术，效果如下所述。你只能使用一块心智水晶来修改法术，不能在同一个法术上同时使用心智水晶和元术选项。一旦你使用了心智水晶，它就变成一颗价值50gp的非魔法宝石。

效果。选择一个受法术影响的生物。该生物在对该法术进行的第一次豁免检定中有劣势(disadvantage)。

Ironquill's Journal and Bookplate.name: 铁羽的日记本和书签。
Ironquill's Journal and Bookplate.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh7tunnelsde.JournalEntryPage.doMvucAxNgnTscja]{J2.}@Embed[JournalEntry.pbsoCh7art000000.JournalEntryPage.epqj8hlUZJ3wuFKg]{ }

这个华丽的书签上刻着“索尔格兰·铁笔，历史学家”的名字。日记的前几页仍然存在。它们包括有关剑山下升起的探索者活动的传言。日记的作者计划潜入地下深处一个名为伊利西诺克的探索者据点。作者希望这些信息能让他警告附近的矮人聚居地，包括塔尔亨德雷斯的神殿。

尽管这个华丽的银质书签本身就很有价值，但日记的剩余部分可能对特定学者非常感兴趣。

Mind Crystal.name: 心智水晶(Mind Crystal)
Mind Crystal.description:
奇妙物品，稀有度各异

这些宝石包含了结晶化的一点施法魔法。存在不同类型的心智水晶，每种都具有不同的一次性效果。

当你持有一颗心智水晶施放施法时间为1个行动的法术时，你可以以特定方式修改法术，具有下面描述的效果。你只能使用一颗心智水晶来修改法术，而且你不能在同一个法术上同时使用心智水晶和一个元术选项。一旦你使用了心智水晶，它就变成一颗价值50gp的非魔法宝石。

谨慎(不寻常)。选择最多三个受法术影响的生物。被选择的生物对该法术的豁免扑克自动成功。

遥远(不寻常)。如果法术的射程为5英尺或更远，并且不是自身射程，法术的射程增加100英尺。如果法术的射程是触碰，它的射程变为30英尺。

强化(不寻常)。当你掷骰子造成法术伤害时，你可以重新掷最多三个伤害骰。你必须使用新的点数。

延长(不寻常)。如果法术的持续时间为1分钟或更长，将法术的持续时间加倍，最长持续时间为24小时。

提升(稀有)。选择一个受法术影响的生物。该生物在对该法术进行的第一次豁免扑克上有劣势。

迅速(稀有)。你将法术的施法时间改为1个奖励行动。

微妙(普通)。你在这次施法中不需要任何手势或口头组件。

Ornamental Crystal Daggers.name: 装饰性水晶匕首 (Ornamental Crystal Daggers)

Statue Mucus.name: 雕像黏液(statue mucus)
Statue Mucus.description: 这种粘液味道平淡但营养丰富，而且奇怪地有助于精神力量。任何角色食用这种液体后，在接下来的10分钟内对精神伤害获得【rule=damagevulnerability】{resistance}。这种脑浆的效力在1小时后消失。

Antique Maps.name: 古董地图
Antique Maps.description: 一组历史悠久的地下世界古董地图。对历史学家或收藏家有价值。

Beholder Statuette.name: 眼魔雕像(Beholder)
Beholder Statuette.description: 一尊拥有翡翠眼柄末端和巨大钻石中央眼睛的眼魔小雕像

Jeweler's Tools.name: 珠宝工具 (D&D)
Jeweler's Tools.description:
这些特殊工具包括从事珠宝工艺或贸易所需的物品。

熟练使用一套工匠工具可以让你在使用这些工具进行工艺时，将你的熟练加值加到任何相关技能检定中。每种类型的工匠工具都需要单独的熟练。

Keoghtom's Ointment.name: 柯奥格汤(Keoghtom)的药膏(Ointment)
Keoghtom's Ointment.description:
奇妙物品

这个玻璃罐直径3英寸，里面装有4份散发着淡淡芦荟味道的浓稠混合物。罐子和里面的内容总重量为1/2磅。

作为一个动作，可以吞服或涂抹一份药膏。接受药膏的生物会恢复2d8+2点生命值，解除中毒状态，并治愈任何疾病。

Potion of Poison.name: 毒药药水 (Potion of Poison)
Potion of Poison.description: 这个混合物看起来、闻起来和尝起来像是一瓶治疗药水或其他有益的药水。然而，它实际上是被幻术魔法掩盖的毒药。一个识破法术会揭示它的真实本质。如果你喝下它，你会受到3d6点毒性伤害，并且你必须成功通过一次DC 13的体质豁免才能不被毒害。在你被这种方式中毒时的每个回合开始时，你会受到3d6点毒性伤害。在每个回合结束时，你可以重复这次豁免才能。在成功豁免后，你在随后的回合中受到的毒性伤害会减少1d6。当伤害减少到0时，毒性效果结束。【秘密铸造笔记】为了应用成功体质豁免后减少的伤害，请根据需要使用其他公式(设置为1d6)。

Quickened Mind Crystal.name: 迅捷心晶 (Quickened Mind Crystal).
Quickened Mind Crystal.description:
奇妙物品(Rare)

这些宝石包含了结晶化的施法魔法。存在不同类型的心智水晶，每种都具有不同的单次使用效果。

当你持有一颗心智水晶施放施法时间为1个行动的法术时，你可以以特定方式修改法术，具体效果如下所述。你只能使用一颗心智水晶来修改法术，不能在同一个法术上同时使用心智水晶和元术选项。一旦你使用了心智水晶，它就变成一颗价值50gp的非魔法宝石。

效果。 你将法术的施法时间改为1个奖励行动。

Robe with Pockets.name: 带口袋的长袍 (Robe with Pockets)
Robe with Pockets.description:
在@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh7illithino.JournalEntryPage.xFsR5vTCrGLrX0Cc]{X14.}中找到

内袋中有两瓶外观相同的药水。

Subtle Mind Crystal.name: 微妙心晶 (Subtle Mind Crystal)
Subtle Mind Crystal.description:
奇妙物品，普通(Wondrous Item, Common)

这些宝石包含了结晶化的施法魔法。存在不同类型的心智水晶，每种都具有不同的一次性效果。

当你持有一颗心智水晶施放施法时间为1个行动的法术时，你可以以特定方式修改法术，具体效果如下所述。你只能使用一颗心智水晶来修改法术，不能在同一个法术上同时使用心智水晶和元术选项(Metamagic option)。一旦你使用了心智水晶，它就变成一颗价值50金币的非魔法宝石。

效果。 你在施法时不需要进行手势或口头咒语。

Mind Blast.name: 心灵冲击(Mind Blast)
Mind Blast.description: 狂热者(Zealot)在一个60英尺锥形范围内魔法地释放出精神能量。该区域内的每个生物必须成功通过一次DC 15的智力豁免才能避免受到22(4d8 + 4)点精神伤害，并且陷入石化状态(stunned)1分钟。目标可以在自己的回合结束时重复进行豁免才能，成功则结束自身的石化状态。

Psychic Slam.name: 心灵猛击 (Psychic Slam)
Psychic Slam.description:
近战武器攻击: +5命中，射程5英尺，目标一个。命中: 6(1d6 + 3) 钝击伤害加上3(1d6) 精神伤害。

镇民用外域能量发动攻击。

Blessing of the Solipsistic Mind.name: 唯我心灵的祝福 (Blessing of the Solipsistic Mind)
Blessing of the Solipsistic Mind.description:
你通过深入专注于自己的思维，从一本古老的书中获得了神秘的真理。你可以采取行动来专注你的内心思维。这种专注持续1小时。当你的内心思维专注时，你不能进行&Reference[reaction]{reactions.}。

在持续时间内，当你进行智力检定、感知检定、智力豁免检定或感知豁免检定时，你可以投掷一个d8，并将投掷的数字加到属性检定或豁免检定上。当你完成一次长休后，你恢复专注内心思维的能力。

Cape of Enlargement.name: 扩大斗篷(Cape of Enlargement)
Cape of Enlargement.description:
奇妙物品，极其稀有(需要须配戴)

发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh8brinymaze.JournalEntryPage.I8k8EFYg3y4FHCgH]{B2.}

古代符文被银线绣在这件灰紫色披风的边缘。

这件披风有3个充能。在佩戴这件披风时，你可以在奖励行动中消耗其中的1个充能，使自己变大，获得以下好处：

  • 你的体型增加一个种类——例如从中等变为大型。如果没有足够的空间让你的体型增加一个种类，你将变成可用空间中可能的最大尺寸。

  • 你在力量检定和力量豁免上获得优势。

  • 当你使用武器或徒手攻击命中时，你可以将你的熟练加值加到攻击的伤害上。

这些好处持续10分钟，或者直到你使用另一个奖励行动来解除它们。这件披风每天黎明时恢复1d3个已消耗的充能。

Flayer Slayer.name: 剥皮者杀手 (Flayer Slayer)
Flayer Slayer.description:
武器 (巨斧), 稀有 (需要须配)

这把巨斧的金属刀刃上雕刻着被斩首的畸形脑食者。

你使用这把巨斧进行的攻击和伤害骰获得+1的奖励。

被这把巨斧击中的畸形生物额外受到1d12点斩击伤害。如果该畸形生物当前正控制一名生物，该畸形生物必须通过一次DC 15的力量豁免检定，否则释放它所控制的每个生物。

Metal Tongue.name: 金属之舌 (Metal Tongue)
Metal Tongue.description:
发现在@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoOccludingMia.JournalEntryPage.GzuBwWdyY2ELY48g]{Occluding Miasma.}

舌头大约1英尺长，宽度为一半。

Mindblasting Cap.name: 心灵震爆帽 (Mindblasting Cap)
Mindblasting Cap.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh8brinymaze.JournalEntryPage.eJUjJD548m7pElFP]{B21.}

神奇物品，极其稀有(需要须臾)

这顶柔软的紫色帽子上绣着脑子褶皱的图案。

戴上这顶帽子后，你可以在作为奖励动作的情况下，释放出一个60英尺锥形的精神能量。该区域内的每个生物必须进行一次DC 15的智力豁免检定。未通过检定的生物会受到5d8点精神伤害，并且陷入&Reference[stunned]状态1分钟。通过检定的生物只会受到一半伤害。在其回合结束时，处于昏迷状态的生物可以重复进行豁免检定，成功后结束自身的昏迷状态。

一旦使用了这个奖励动作，直到第二天黎明前都无法再次使用。

Potion of Supreme Healing.name: 至高治疗药水 (Potion of Supreme Healing)
Potion of Supreme Healing.description:
药水的红色液体在搅动时闪闪发光。

当你喝下这瓶药水时，你恢复10d4+20点生命值。

Shalfi's Ivory Pipes.name: 沙尔菲的象牙烟斗 (Shalfi's Ivory Pipes)

Silver Great Sword.name: 白银巨剑(Silver Great Sword)
Silver Great Sword.description:
近战武器攻击: +9命中，射程5英尺，一目标。 命中: 13 (2d6 + 6) 1d6 slashing伤害加上10 (3d6) psychic伤害。这是一次魔法武器攻击。对于一个处于星界身体中的目标(如@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TIoadMIsUKD4edXi]{astral projection}法术)，吉特援奇可以切断将目标与其物质身体相连的银色绳索，而不是造成伤害。

骑士用它的银色巨剑发动攻击。

Spell Scroll: Cone of Cold.name: 法术卷轴：冰锥(Cone of Cold)
Spell Scroll: Cone of Cold.description:
一个法术卷轴上写着一条法术的文字，用神秘的密码书写。如果这个法术在你的职业法术列表中，你可以阅读卷轴并施放其法术，无需提供任何材料组件。否则，卷轴是无法理解的。通过阅读卷轴施放法术需要法术的正常施法时间。一旦法术被施放，卷轴上的文字会消失，然后它会化为灰尘。如果施法被打断，卷轴不会消失。

冰霜喷吐 (5级)

一股寒冷的气流从你的手中喷发。60英尺锥形范围内的每个生物必须进行一次体质豁免才能。未通过豁免的生物受到8d8点冰冷伤害，通过豁免的生物受到一半伤害。

被这个法术杀死的生物会变成冰冻的雕像，直到解冻。

更高等级. 当你使用6级或更高级的法术位施放这个法术时，伤害会每个高出5级的法术位增加1d8点。

卷轴详情

如果卷轴上的法术在你的职业法术列表中，但高于你通常可以施放的等级，你必须进行一次DC 15的能力检定，使用你的施法能力来确定你是否成功施放。检定失败，法术会从卷轴上消失，没有其他效果。

卷轴上法术的等级决定了法术的豁免DC和攻击加值，以及卷轴的稀有度。

豁免DC: 17
攻击加值: +9。

法师卷轴上的法术可以像法术书中的法术一样被复制。当从法术卷轴上复制法术时，复制者必须成功进行一次DC 15的智力(奥术)检定。如果检定成功，法术会被成功复制。无论检定成功与否，法术卷轴都会被销毁。

Amulet of Proof against Detection and Lo.name: 抗侦测和定位护身符 (D&D)
Amulet of Proof against Detection and Lo.description:
奇妙物品 (需要感应)

佩戴这个护身符时，你对占卜魔法隐匿不见。你不能被这类魔法瞄准，也无法通过魔法侦查传感器感知到。

Box of Silver Forks.name: 银叉盒 (Box of Silver Forks)
Box of Silver Forks.description: 一个装有几把银色六齿叉子的盒子。

Githyanki Chest.name: 吉斯燕基宝箱
Githyanki Chest.description:
发现于@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh8brinymaze.JournalEntryPage.DYd8QV7jXDxJ1nCJ]{B7.}

箱子里装满了吉斯亚奴奇(githyanki)在长途探险中获得的财宝，他们一直追寻着盐水迷宫(Briny Maze)的踪迹。

Spell Scroll: Comprehend Languages.name: 法术卷轴：(理解语言)
Spell Scroll: Comprehend Languages.description:
一个法术卷轴上写着一条法术的文字，用一种神秘的密码书写。如果这个法术在你的职业法术列表中，你可以阅读卷轴并施放其法术，无需提供任何材料组件。否则，这个卷轴就无法理解。通过阅读卷轴施放法术需要法术的正常施法时间。一旦法术被施放，卷轴上的文字就会消失，卷轴化为灰尘。如果施法被打断，卷轴不会消失。

理解语言 (Level 1)

在持续时间内，你能理解听到的任何口语的字面意思。你也能理解看到的任何书面语言，但必须触摸文字所写的表面。阅读一页文字大约需要1分钟。

这个法术无法解码文本或符文中的秘密信息，比如奥术符文，只有它们不是书面语言的一部分。

卷轴详情

如果卷轴上的法术在你的职业法术列表中，但比你通常可以施放的等级高，你必须进行一次 DC 11 的能力检定，使用你的施法能力来确定你是否成功施放。检定失败时，法术从卷轴上消失，没有其他效果。

卷轴上法术的等级决定了法术的豁免 DC 和攻击加值，以及卷轴的稀有度。

豁免 DC: 13
攻击加值: +5。

法师卷轴上的法术可以像法术书中的法术一样被复制。当从法术卷轴上复制法术时，复制者必须成功进行一次 DC 11 的智力(奥术)检定。如果检定成功，法术就成功被复制。无论检定成功与否，法术卷轴都会被摧毁。

Spell Scroll: Tongues.name: 法术卷轴：语言(Tongues)
Spell Scroll: Tongues.description:
A spell scroll bears the words of a single spell, written in a mystical cipher. If the spell is on your class's spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without providing any material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and it crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

Tongues (Level 3)

This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken language it hears. Moreover, when the target speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the target understands what it says.

Scroll Details

If the spell is on your class's spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you must make a DC 13 ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast it successfully. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect.

The level of the spell on the scroll determines the spell's saving throw DC and attack bonus, as well as the scroll's rarity.

Save DC: 15
Attack Bonus: +7.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll, the copier must succeed on a DC 13 Intelligence (Arcana) check. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

Wizard's Study.name: Wizard's Study
Wizard's Study.description:
Found in @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoEmptyBridge0.JournalEntryPage.i2SxYm8bW3pKwcME]{Empty Bridge.}

The desk holds a journal splattered with blood and brains. The journal outlines the wizard’s plan to survey the Endless Void by first listing its observable floating nodules. The tone of the writing is dismissive and arrogant; in multiple places, the writer confidently insists that his magic amulet makes him utterly immune to Ilvaash’s detection.

The journal contains the following notes:

Cyclical System. Each floating island in the void has its own gravity and terrain. The writer posits that their erratic drifting might be part of a larger cycle or system.

Easily Avoidable Trap. The journal’s author didn’t build the bridge or the tower. The bridge bears a magical ward, but the writer is far too clever to be taken in by a mere magical trap and hasn’t studied it in detail.

Godlet’s Home. Ilvaash’s island has a huge, shallow bowl surrounded by ossified tentacles. Eerie mist surrounds this nodule, and strange shapes appear within the mist. This location seems to unnerve the writer, as its descriptions contain no mocking observations.

Naga Lair. The journal’s author describes a swamp-covered nodule inhabited by skulking nagas who lure travelers to their doom with subterfuge and trickery. The nagas didn’t anticipate someone of the writer’s perspicacity.

Occluding Miasma. What the author refers to as the Occluding Miasma doesn’t appear to be an island at all, but a cohesive ball of toxic fog. If there’s anything at its hidden center, it must be very small and thus of no consequence.

Toppled Statue. One of the floating islands is a toppled statue that depicts a mind flayer with a human mouth. The statue’s construction was obviously flawed, likely due to an overlarge chamber built into the statue’s apex, making it top-heavy.

Acolyte.name: Acolyte
Acolyte.description:
You have spent your life in the service of a temple to a specific god or pantheon of gods. You act as an intermediary between the realm of the holy and the mortal world, performing sacred rites and offering sacrifices in order to conduct worshipers into the presence of the divine. You are not necessarily a cleric—performing sacred rites is not the same thing as channeling divine power.

Choose a god, a pantheon of gods, or some other quasi-divine being from among those listed in @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.udVPA9JW5wy5t3G5.JournalEntryPage.2lysbY50fgv1R3v7]{Fantasy-Historical Pantheons}, and work with your DM to detail the nature of your religious service. Were you a lesser functionary in a temple, raised from childhood to assist the priests in the sacred rites? Or were you a high priest who suddenly experienced a call to serve your god in a different way? Perhaps you were the leader of a small cult outside of any established temple structure, or even an occult group that served a fiendish master that you now deny.

Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Religion

Languages: Two of your choice

Equipment: A holy symbol (a gift to you when you entered the priesthood), a prayer book or prayer wheel, 5 sticks of incense, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.irtqrzaUCeshmTZp]{vestments}, a set of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.8RXjiddJ6VGyE7vB]{common clothes}, and a pouch containing 15 gp.

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.backgrounds.Item.64N1NWh9kC1dI7zN]{Shelter of the Faithful}

Suggested Characteristics

Acolytes are shaped by their experience in temples or other religious communities. Their study of the history and tenets of their faith and their relationships to temples, shrines, or hierarchies affect their mannerisms and ideals. Their flaws might be some hidden hypocrisy or heretical idea, or an ideal or bond taken to an extreme.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.HDzErjwy3TseLOZX]{Personality Traits}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.W9xqQZy0Ad0CwkN2]{Ideals}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.DZhd8JkjqlpCP8EB]{Bonds}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.COIHGOnoJnmXduad]{Flaws}

Charlatan.name: Charlatan
Charlatan.description:
You have always had a way with people. You know what makes them tick, you can tease out their hearts’ desires after a few minutes of conversation, and with a few leading questions you can read them like they were children’s books. It’s a useful talent, and one that you’re perfectly willing to use for your advantage.

You know what people want and you deliver, or rather, you promise to deliver. Common sense should steer people away from things that sound too good to be true, but common sense seems to be in short supply when you’re around. The bottle of pink-colored liquid will surely cure that unseemly rash, this ointment — nothing more than a bit of fat with a sprinkle of silver dust — can restore youth and vigor, and there’s a bridge in the city that just happens to be for sale. These marvels sound implausible, but you make them sound like the real deal.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[skill=deception], &Reference[skill=slt]

Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit, Forgery kit

Equipment: A set of fine clothes, a disguise kit, tools of the con of your choice (ten stoppered bottles filled with colored liquid, a set of weighted dice, a deck of marked cards, or a signet ring of an imaginary duke), and a pouch containing 15 gp.

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoFalseIdentit]

Favorite Schemes

Every charlatan has an angle he or she uses in preference to other schemes. Choose a favorite scam or roll on the table below.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoFavoriteSche]

Suggested Characteristics

Charlatans are colorful characters who conceal their true selves behind the masks they construct. They reflect what people want to see, what they want to believe, and how they see the world. But their true selves are sometimes plagued by an uneasy conscience, an old enemy, or deep-seated trust issues.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCharltrait00] @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCharlideal00] @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCharlbond000] @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCharlflaw000]

Criminal.name: Criminal
Criminal.description:
You are an experienced criminal with a history of breaking the law. You have spent a lot of time among other criminals and still have contacts within the criminal underworld. You’re far closer than most people to the world of murder, theft, and violence that pervades the underbelly of civilization, and you have survived up to this point by flouting the rules and regulations of society.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[deception], &Reference[stealth]

Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set, thieves' tools

Equipment: A crowbar, a set of dark common clothes including a hood, and a belt pouch containing 15 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoCriminalCont]

Criminal Specialty

There are many kinds of criminals, and within a thieves' guild or similar criminal organization, individual members have particular specialties. Even criminals who operate outside of such organizations have strong preferences for certain kinds of crimes over others. Choose the role you played in your criminal life, or roll on the table below.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCriminalSpec]

Suggested Characteristics

Criminals might seem like villains on the surface, and many of them are villainous to the core. But some have an abundance of endearing, if not redeeming, characteristics. There might be honor among thieves, but criminals rarely show any respect for law or authority.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCrimtrait000]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCrimideal000]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCrimbond0000]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoCrimflaw0000]{Flaw}

Entertainer.name: Entertainer
Entertainer.description:
You thrive in front of an audience. You know how to entrance them, entertain them, and even inspire them. Your poetics can stir the hearts of those who hear you, awakening grief or joy, laughter or anger. Your music raises their spirits or captures their sorrow. Your dance steps captivate, your humor cuts to the quick. Whatever techniques you use, your art is your life.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[acrobatics], &Reference[performance]

Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit, one type of musical instrument

Equipment: A musical instrument (one of your choice), the favor of an admirer (love letter, lock of hair, or trinket), a costume, and a pouch containing 15 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoByPopularDem]

Entertainer Routines

A good entertainer is versatile, spicing up every performance with a variety of different routines. Choose one to three routines or roll on the table below to define your expertise as an entertainer.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoEntroutines0]{Entertainer Routines}

Suggested Characteristics

Successful entertainers have to be able to capture and hold an audience’s attention, so they tend to have flamboyant or forceful personalities. They’re inclined toward the romantic and often cling to high-minded ideals about the practice of art and the appreciation of beauty.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoEnttrat00000]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoEntideal0000]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoEntbond00000]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoEntflaw00000]{Flaw}

Folk Hero.name: Folk Hero
Folk Hero.description:
You come from a humble social rank, but you are destined for so much more. Already the people of your home village regard you as their champion, and your destiny calls you to stand against the tyrants and monsters that threaten the common folk everywhere.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[skill=ani], &Reference[survival]

Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan’s tools, vehicles (land)

Equipment: A set of artisan’s tools (one of your choice), a shovel, an iron pot, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp.

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoRusticHospit]

Defining Event

You previously pursued a simple profession among the peasantry, perhaps as a farmer, miner, servant, shepherd, woodcutter, or gravedigger. But something happened that set you on a different path and marked you for greater things. Choose or randomly determine a defining event that marked you as a hero of the people.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoDefiningEven]

Suggested Characteristics

A folk hero is one of the common people, for better or for worse. Most folk heroes look on their humble origins as a virtue, not a shortcoming, and their home communities remain very important to them.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoFolktrait000]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoFolkideal000]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoFolkbond0000]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoFolkflaw0000]{Flaw}

Guild Artisan.name: Guild Artisan
Guild Artisan.description:
You are a member of an artisan’s guild, skilled in a particular field and closely associated with other artisans. You are a well-established part of the mercantile world, freed by talent and wealth from the constraints of a feudal social order. You learned your skills as an apprentice to a master artisan, under the sponsorship of your guild, until you became a master in your own right.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[insight], &Reference[persuasion]

Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan’s tools

Languages: One of your choice

Equipment: A set of artisan’s tools (one of your choice), a letter of introduction from your guild, a set of traveler’s clothes, and a pouch containing 15 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoGuildMembers]

Guild Business

Guilds are generally found in cities large enough to support several artisans practicing the same trade. However, your guild might instead be a loose network of artisans who each work in a different village within a larger realm. Work with your DM to determine the nature of your guild. You can select your guild business from the Guild Business table or roll randomly.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoGuildBusines]{Guild Business}

Suggested Characteristics

Guild artisans are among the most ordinary people in the world—until they set down their tools and take up an adventuring career. They understand the value of hard work and the importance of community, but they’re vulnerable to sins of greed and covetousness.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoGuildtrait00]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoGuildideal00]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoGuildbond000]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoGuildflaw000]{Flaw}

Hermit.name: Hermit
Hermit.description:
You lived in seclusion—either in a sheltered community such as a monastery, or entirely alone—for a formative part of your life. In your time apart from the clamor of society, you found quiet, solitude, and perhaps some of the answers you were looking for.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[medicine], &Reference[religion]

Tool Proficiencies: Herbalism kit

Languages: One of your choice

Equipment: A scroll case stuffed full of notes from your studies or prayers, a winter blanket, a set of common clothes, an herbalism kit, and 5 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoDiscovery000]

Life of Seclusion

What was the reason for your isolation, and what changed to allow you to end your solitude? You can work with your DM to determine the exact nature of your seclusion, or you can choose or roll on the table below to determine the reason behind your seclusion.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoLifeOfSeclus]

Suggested Characteristics

Some hermits are well suited to a life of seclusion, whereas others chafe against it and long for company. Whether they embrace solitude or long to escape it, the solitary life shapes their attitudes and ideals.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoHermittrait0]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoHermitideal0]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoHermitbond00]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoHermitflaw00]{Flaw}

Noble.name: Noble
Noble.description:
You understand wealth, power, and privilege. You carry a noble title, and your family owns land, collects taxes, and wields significant political influence. You might be a pampered aristocrat unfamiliar with work or discomfort, a former merchant just elevated to the nobility, or a disinherited scoundrel with a disproportionate sense of entitlement. Or you could be an honest, hard-working landowner who cares deeply about the people who live and work on your land, keenly aware of your responsibility to them.

Work with your DM to come up with an appropriate title and determine how much authority that title carries. A noble title doesn’t stand on its own—it’s connected to an entire family, and whatever title you hold, you will pass it down to your own children. Not only do you need to determine your noble title, but you should also work with the DM to describe your family and their influence on you.

Is your family old and established, or was your title only recently bestowed? How much influence do they wield, and over what area? What kind of reputation does your family have among the other aristocrats of the region? How do the common people regard them?

What’s your position in the family? Are you the heir to the head of the family? Have you already inherited the title? How do you feel about that responsibility? Or are you so far down the line of inheritance that no one cares what you do, as long as you don’t embarrass the family? How does the head of your family feel about your adventuring career? Are you in your family’s good graces, or shunned by the rest of your family?

Does your family have a coat of arms? An insignia you might wear on a signet ring? Particular colors you wear all the time? An animal you regard as a symbol of your line or even a spiritual member of the family?

These details help establish your family and your title as features of the world of the campaign.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[history], &Reference[persuasion]

Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set

Languages: One of your choice

Equipment: A set of fine clothes, a signet ring, a scroll of pedigree, and a purse containing 25 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoPositionOfPr]{Position of Privilege}

Suggested Characteristics

Nobles are born and raised to a very different lifestyle than most people ever experience, and their personalities reflect that upbringing. A noble title comes with a plethora of bonds—responsibilities to family, to other nobles (including the sovereign), to the people entrusted to the family’s care, or even to the title itself. But this responsibility is often a good way to undermine a noble.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoNobletrait00]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoNobleideal00]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoNoblebond000]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoNobleflaw000]{Flaw}

Outlander.name: Outlander
Outlander.description:
You grew up in the wilds, far from the comforts of town and technology. You’ve witnessed the migration of herds larger than forests, survived weather more extreme than any city-dweller could comprehend, and enjoyed the solitude of being the only thinking creature for miles in any direction. The wilds are in your blood, whether you were a nomad, an explorer, a recluse, a hunter-gatherer, or even a marauder. Even in places where you don’t know the specific features of the terrain, you know the ways of the wild.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[athletics], &Reference[survival]

Tool Proficiencies: One type of musical instrument

Languages: One of your choice

Equipment: A staff, a hunting trap, a trophy from an animal you killed, a set of traveler’s clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoWanderer0000]{Wanderer}

Origin

You’ve been to strange places and seen things that others cannot begin to fathom. Consider some of the distant lands you have visited, and how they impacted you. You can roll on the following table to determine your occupation during your time in the wild, or choose one that best fits your character.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoOrigin000000]{Origin}

Suggested Characteristics

Often considered rude and uncouth, outlanders have little respect for the niceties of life in the cities. The ties of tribe, clan, family, and the natural world of which they are a part are the most important bonds to most outlanders.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoOutlandertra]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoOutlanderide]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoOutlanderbon]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoOutlanderfla]{Flaw}

Sage.name: Sage
Sage.description:
You spent years learning the lore of the multiverse. You scoured manuscripts, studied scrolls, and listened to the greatest experts on the subjects that interest you. Your efforts have made you a master in your fields of study.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[arcana], &Reference[history]

Languages: Two of your choice

Equipment: A bottle of black ink, a quill, a small knife, a letter from a dead colleague posing a question you have not yet been able to answer, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoResearcher00]{Researcher}

Specialty

To determine the nature of your scholarly training, roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSpecialty000]{Specialty}

Suggested Characteristics

Sages are defined by their extensive studies, and their characteristics reflect this life of study. Devoted to scholarly pursuits, a sage values knowledge highly—sometimes in its own right, sometimes as a means toward other ideals.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSagetrait000]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoOutlanderide]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoOutlanderbon]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoOutlanderfla]{Flaw}

Sailor.name: Sailor
Sailor.description:
You sailed on a seagoing vessel for years. In that time, you faced down mighty storms, monsters of the deep, and those who wanted to sink your craft to the bottomless depths. Your first love is the distant line of the horizon, but the time has come to try your hand at something new.

Discuss the nature of the ship you previously sailed with your Dungeon Master. Was it a merchant ship, a naval vessel, a ship of discovery, or a pirate ship? How famous (or infamous) is it? Is it widely traveled? Is it still sailing, or is it missing and presumed lost with all hands?

What were your duties on board—boatswain, captain, navigator, cook, or some other position? Who were the captain and first mate? Did you leave your ship on good terms with your fellows, or on the run?

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[athletics], &Reference[perception]

Tool Proficiencies: Navigator’s tools, vehicles (water)

Equipment: A belaying pin (club), 50 feet of silk rope, a lucky charm such as a rabbit foot or a small stone with a hole in the center (or you may roll for a random trinket on the Trinkets table in chapter 5 of the Player’s Handbook), a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoShipsPassage]{Ship’s Passage}

Suggested Characteristics

Sailors can be a rough lot, but the responsibilities of life on a ship make them generally reliable as well. Life aboard a ship shapes their outlook and forms their most important attachments.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSailtrait000]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSailideal000]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSailbond0000]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSailflaw0000]{Flaw}

Shelter of the Faithful.name: Shelter of the Faithful
Shelter of the Faithful.description:
As an acolyte, you command the respect of those who share your faith, and you can perform the religious ceremonies of your deity. You and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free healing and care at a temple, shrine, or other established presence of your faith, though you must provide any material components needed for spells. Those who share your religion will support you (but only you) at a modest lifestyle.

You might also have ties to a specific temple dedicated to your chosen deity or pantheon, and you have a residence there. This could be the temple where you used to serve, if you remain on good terms with it, or a temple where you have found a new home. While near your temple, you can call upon the priests for assistance, provided the assistance you ask for is not hazardous and you remain in good standing with your temple.

Soldier.name: Soldier
Soldier.description:
War has been your life for as long as you care to remember. You trained as a youth, studied the use of weapons and armor, learned basic survival techniques, including how to stay alive on the battlefield. You might have been part of a standing national army or a mercenary company, or perhaps a member of a local militia who rose to prominence during a recent war.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine which military organization you were a part of, how far through its ranks you progressed, and what kind of experiences you had during your military career. Was it a standing army, a town guard, or a village militia? Or it might have been a noble’s or merchant’s private army, or a mercenary company.

Skill Proficiencies: &Reference[athletics], &Reference[intimidation]

Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set, vehicles (land)

Equipment: An insignia of rank, a trophy taken from a fallen enemy (a dagger, broken blade, or piece of a banner), a set of bone dice or deck of cards, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

Feature: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-options.Item.pbsoMilitaryRank]{Military Rank}

Specialty

During your time as a soldier, you had a specific role to play in your unit or army. Roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below to determine your role.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSpecialtySol]{Specialty}

Suggested Characteristics

The horrors of war combined with the rigid discipline of military service leave their mark on all soldiers, shaping their ideals, creating strong bonds, and often leaving them scarred and vulnerable to fear, shame, and hatred.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSoldtrait000]{Personality Trait} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSoldideal000]{Ideal} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSoldbond0000]{Bond} @UUID[Compendium.dnd-phandelver-below.pbso-player-tables.RollTable.pbsoSoldflaw0000]{Flaw}

Wandering Monsters.name: Wandering Monsters
Wandering Monsters.description: If the characters spend a long time in an area, you can check for wandering monsters by rolling a [[/r 1d20]]. On a roll of 17–20, an encounter takes place. Conversely, if the players seem restless, you can decide that an encounter occurs.

results.6-6: [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Actor.tFJX45zj3QDc3Zli]{grick}

Goblin Mischief.name: Goblin Mischief
Goblin Mischief.description: Whenever the characters finish investigating one of the goblin crime scenes, consult this table to see what occurs.

results.1-1: A @UUID[Actor.pbsoGoblinPsiCom]{goblin psi commander} is lighting small fires around the Alderleaf Farm, and these fires threaten to set the crops ablaze.
results.2-2: Four @UUID[Actor.TjWQOgI3A4UAl7lC]{goblins} surround an older human woman and attempt to steal her purse. The @UUID[Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{woman} aggressively fights the goblins.
results.3-3: Three @UUID[Actor.TjWQOgI3A4UAl7lC]{goblins} stole a @UUID[Actor.y8sRU8Ks2lcrGsaf]{goat} and are attempting to run away with it. The goat, however, refuses to move.
results.4-4: A pair of @UUID[Actor.pbsoGoblinPsiBra]{goblin psi brawlers} are hiding in the trees of the Edermath Orchard. The goblins are using their telepathy to masquerade as ghosts and scare off others so they can steal apples uninterrupted.
results.5-5: Five @UUID[Actor.TjWQOgI3A4UAl7lC]{goblins} fling refuse at passers-by from the alley behind Stonehill Inn.
results.6-6: Three @UUID[Actor.TjWQOgI3A4UAl7lC]{goblins} splash paint across the side of Harbin Wester’s home
results.7-7: Shingles from the roof of the Sleeping Giant are flying toward a group of five confused @UUID[Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{miners.} Unbeknownst to them, a cackling @UUID[Actor.pbsoGoblinPsiCom]{goblin psi commander} on the tavern roof is the source of the mischief.
results.8-8: One @UUID[Actor.pbsoGoblinPsiBra]{goblin psi brawler} and two @UUID[Actor.TjWQOgI3A4UAl7lC]{goblins} are camped at the entrance to Triboar Trail, waiting to ambush unsuspecting travelers.
results.9-9: Two @UUID[Actor.TjWQOgI3A4UAl7lC]{goblins} released two @UUID[Actor.Bupo3E9X5Ptx6XeT]{draft horses} that are now running rampant across town.
results.10-10: Two @UUID[Actor.pbsoGoblinPsiBra]{goblin psi brawlers} have poorly disguised themselves as children and are pestering a baker for sweets near the Stonehill Inn.

Crypt Hauntings.name: Crypt Hauntings
Crypt Hauntings.description:
If the characters take a long rest in the crypt, you can have a random crypt haunting appear at that location anytime during their rest. These spontaneous hauntings can’t be put to rest, but they don’t need to be quelled to purify the crypt. Once the crypt is purified no haunts ever occur there.

These hauntings are disturbing, and the fifth and sixth options on the table below involve body horror. Check your players’ comfort level before including these hauntings in your game; you can roll a d4 instead or lock (  ) those results.

results.1-1: Each character feels a creeping sensation along their scalp, as of probing tentacles seeking a weak spot in their skull.
results.2-2: The ghostly image of an elderly dwarf in priestly vestments wanders around as though in shock, gripping a battleaxe stained with purple ichor.
results.3-3: Each character gains a nagging suspicion that mind flayers are currently invading some sacred or secret place important to that character, such as a childhood home.
results.4-4: Each character hears low muttering in Dwarvish that repeats, “The brain eaters have come! Save us! If you cannot save us, avenge us!”
results.5-5: A ghostly image of one character (determined randomly) lies on the floor, their skull cracked open and their brain removed. The image does nothing but twitch and drool.
results.6-6: The ghostly image of a dwarf zombie lurches from a wall, puts a rotted finger to its lips, then uses its other hand to peel back its ribcage and reveal a gem hidden in its chest cavity. The zombie then disappears into the wall. This image repeats every few minutes, but the ghostly zombie comes from a different section of the wall each time.

Crystal Images.name: Crystal Images
Crystal Images.description: The three newer crystals are results 1, 2, and 3; if a character examines the newer crystals, use only those results. There are 40 crystals in this room, though many of the older crystals impart the same scenes.

results.1-1: A mind flayer holding a disembodied head chants over a large pool filled with a pink, quivering gelatinous mass (the brain pool in @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh7illithino.Yc2CgRktnHDElf1R]{area X15}). Two other mind flayers are nearby, but their features are unclear. A strange, jagged portal appears behind the trio and then disappears. The mind flayer is visibly frustrated by this result, telepathically intoning, “We will try again. In Ilvaash’s name, we will keep trying.”
results.2-2: A mind flayer with tentacles at the ends of its arms lashes a hand-tentacle across the face of a shriveled mind flayer with a single, staring eye, drawing blood. Several strange pods line the walls (@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh7illithino.oo9ELp7kXbqSA9KS]{area X12}). A mental message rings out, “You will obey, or the Far Realm shall consume what mind you have left, weakling.”
results.3-3: A beholder floats in a room with stained surgical slabs (@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh7illithino.YfeV9foQJa7ZSvOQ]{area X10}), addressing a mind flayer on a rust-colored floating disk. The mind flayer raises its hands and the beholder shudders, its eye stalks writhing. The beholder telepathically squeals, “I will serve! I will serve!” (This scene shows the creation of Golcuus the oculorb, which lairs in @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh7rifts0000.JournalEntryPage.QEoHb6Yvc5hnX6hH]{area L7.})
results.4-4: A mind flayer wearing a scarlet robe with a high collar directs a battle in a long, descending hall lined with dwarven statues (@UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6talhunder.JournalEntryPage.yxyyMpycWR6HIKnx]{area T2} of Talhundereth). Mind flayers fight fiercely against dwarves.
results.5-5: Three mind flayers sort through a bin of gems near a stone table. One selects the gem that contains this memory. (This scene takes place in @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6crypttalh.JournalEntryPage.jwOdV6Q98BOi9VyA]{area P3} in the Crypt of the Talhund.)
results.20-20: This crystal isn’t a repository of memories, but a @UUID[Item.pbsoHeightenedMi]{heightened mind crystal}. Reroll this result if the characters have already found this crystal.
results.6-19: Choose a random area in @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCh6gibbetcro]{Gibbet Crossing} and describe a short scene where [[1d4]] mind flayers capture and consume one of the area’s former denizens (drow, duergar, or deep gnomes).

Tunnel Encounters.name: Tunnel Encounters
Tunnel Encounters.description:
After each hour the characters spend in the tunnel, roll 1d20 and consult the Tunnel Encounters table to determine whether the party has a random encounter.

If the party is using a light source, creatures that encounter them almost certainly know the characters are coming and set up an ambush or otherwise prepare for the fight.

results.3-3: [[/r 1d6]] @UUID[Actor.8pX2JhWUpTNNRBVx]{gibbering mouthers} lie in wait for prey.
results.4-4: An @UUID[Actor.pbsoIntellectDev]{intellect devourer} inhabits a @UUID[Actor.pbsoQuaggoth0000]{quaggoth}; the intellect devourer seeks another host.
results.5-5: A lost and angry @UUID[Actor.pbsoFomorian0000]{fomorian} wanders the Underdark.
results.6-6: [[/r 1d4 + 1]] @UUID[Actor.pbsoHookHorror00]{hook horrors} climb on the tunnel ceiling.
results.7-7: [[/r 1d6]] @UUID[Actor.pbsoQuaggoth0000]{quaggoths} led by a @UUID[Actor.pbsoQuaggothThon]{quaggoth thonot} are searching for a missing tribe member who’s been acting strangely.
results.8-8: [[/r 1d6]] @UUID[Actor.pbsoTroglodyte00]{troglodytes} and a @UUID[Actor.pbsoBarlgura0000]{barlgura} are looking for a fight.
results.9-9: A patch of [[/r 2d4]] @UUID[Actor.TaK6nQMGqZ0y8gt7]{shriekers} blocks the way ahead; if they shriek, roll @UUID[Macro.8kMkMi53MikZCoo7]{1d8 on this table} to see what creatures come to investigate.

Endless Void Nodules.name: Endless Void Nodules
Endless Void Nodules.description: Whenever the characters arrive on a nodule, roll twice on the Endless Void Nodules table to randomly determine two other nodules that are near enough for the characters to see and reach by flying through the void. Reroll any result that gives the characters’ current nodule. If you roll the same result twice, only that single nodule is in view at the time.

results.1-1: @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoCrystalDome0]{Crystal Dome}
results.2-2: @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoEmptyBridge0]{Empty Bridge}
results.3-3: @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoMireOfDoubt0]{Mire of Doubt}
results.4-4: @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoTheNematode0]{The Nematode}
results.5-5: @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoOccludingMia]{Occluding Miasma}
results.6-6: @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoToppledStatu]{Toppled Statue}
results.8-8: @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoIlvaashsAnim]{Ilvaash's Anima} (reroll if the characters haven’t already visited at least five other nodules)

Stage 1 Transformation Effects.name: Stage 1 Transformation Effects
Stage 1 Transformation Effects.description: The Far Realm reaches out to the character in one of the following ways:

results.1-1: The character awakens from nightmares to an audible, disturbing voice urging them and those around them to go to a particular place or perform a particular act.
results.2-2: The character and those around them hear whispers of bizarre conspiracies or nonsense.
results.3-3: The character recognizes disturbing words now and then in languages they otherwise don’t understand.
results.4-4: The character notices strange patterns in everyday items and events.
results.5-5: The character discovers unfamiliar objects in familiar places.
results.6-6: The character occasionally hears an unfamiliar voice come from their throat when they try to speak.

Stage 2 Transformation Effects.name: Stage 2 Transformation Effects
Stage 2 Transformation Effects.description: The power of the Far Realm begins to alter the character’s body in one of the following unpredictable ways:

results.1-1: A body part temporarily moves or turns 360 degrees.
results.2-2: The character grows one or more eyes or mouths that are not under their control.
results.3-3: The character notices that strange bone protrusions occasionally ripple under their skin.
results.4-4: The character sprouts a tentacle that occasionally picks up Tiny objects.

Stage 3 Transformation Effects.name: Stage 3 Transformation Effects
Stage 3 Transformation Effects.description: Void energy begin to seep into the character’s soul in one of the following ways:

results.1-1: Aberrations view the character as one of their own.
results.2-2: Items tied to the Far Realm hum, glow, or vibrate when the character is nearby.
results.3-3: The character develops an unwanted craving, such as for raw meat, spoiled food, insects, hair, or fingernails.
results.4-4: The character occasionally looks down to discover writing or drawings in their handwriting or style, but that they are certain they didn’t create.
results.5-5: The character sometimes inadvertently communicates telepathically instead of how they normally communicate.
results.6-6: The character sometimes leaves black, sludgy handprints on things they touch.

Stage 4 Transformation Effects.name: Stage 4 Transformation Effects
Stage 4 Transformation Effects.description: The character’s connection to the Far Realm has grown to the extent that they now warp reality within 30 feet of them in one of the following ways:

results.1-1: Creatures no longer cast shadows.
results.2-2: Portable objects not being worn or carried change position.
results.3-3: Mirrors don’t show reflections.
results.4-4: Animals are spooked.
results.5-5: Perishable food spoils.
results.6-6: The temperature increases or decreases.

results.1-1: I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
results.2-2: Someone saved my life on the battlefield. To this day, I will never leave a friend behind.
results.3-3: My honor is my life.
results.4-4: I’ll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.
results.5-5: Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
results.6-6: I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.

Favorite Schemes.name: Favorite Schemes
Favorite Schemes.description: Every charlatan has an angle he or she uses in preference to other schemes. Choose a favorite scam or roll on the table below.

results.1-1: I cheat at games of chance.
results.2-2: I shave coins or forge documents.
results.3-3: I insinuate myself into people’s lives to prey on their weakness and secure their fortunes.
results.4-4: I put on new identities like clothes.
results.5-5: I run sleight-of-hand cons on street corners.
results.6-6: I convince people that worthless junk is worth their hard-earned money.

results.1-1: The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.
results.2-2: I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
results.3-3: I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many lives—and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
results.4-4: My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning.
results.5-5: I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
results.6-6: I’d rather eat my armor than admit when I’m wrong.

results.1-1: Greater Good. Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)
results.2-2: Responsibility. I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)
results.3-3: Independence. When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)
results.4-4: Might. In life as in war, the stronger force wins. (Evil)
results.5-5: Live and Let Live. Ideals aren’t worth killing over or going to war for. (Neutral)
results.6-6: Nation. My city, nation, or people are all that matter. (Any)

results.1-1: I’m always polite and respectful.
results.2-2: I’m haunted by memories of war. I can’t get the images of violence out of my mind.
results.3-3: I’ve lost too many friends, and I’m slow to make new ones.
results.4-4: I’m full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation.
results.5-5: I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
results.6-6: I enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
results.7-7: I have a crude sense of humor.
results.8-8: I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.

Criminal Specialty.name: Criminal Specialty
Criminal Specialty.description: There are many kinds of criminals, and within a thieves’ guild or similar criminal organization, individual members have particular specialties. Even criminals who operate outside of such organizations have strong preferences for certain kinds of crimes over others. Choose the role you played in your criminal life, or roll on the table below.

results.1-1: Blackmailer
results.2-2: Burglar
results.3-3: Enforcer
results.4-4: Fence
results.5-5: Highway robber
results.6-6: Hired killer

Entertainer Routines.name: Entertainer Routines
Entertainer Routines.description: A good entertainer is versatile, spicing up every performance with a variety of different routines. Choose one to three routines or roll on the table below to define your expertise as an entertainer.

results.1-1: Actor
results.2-2: Dancer
results.3-3: Fire-eater
results.4-4: Jester
results.5-5: Juggler
results.6-6: Instrumentalist

Defining Event.name: Defining Event
Defining Event.description: Since you come from the ranks of the common folk, you fit in among them with ease. You can find a place to hide, rest, or recuperate among other commoners, unless you have shown yourself to be a danger to them. They will shield you from the law or anyone else searching for you, though they will not risk their lives for you.

results.1-1: I stood up to a tyrant’s agents.
results.2-2: I saved people during a natural disaster.
results.3-3: I stood alone against a terrible monster.
results.4-4: I stole from a corrupt merchant to help the poor.
results.5-5: I led a militia to fight off an invading army.
results.6-6: I broke into a tyrant’s castle and stole weapons to arm the people.
results.7-7: I trained the peasantry to use farm implements as weapons against a tyrant’s soldiers.
results.8-8: A lord rescinded an unpopular decree after I led a symbolic act of protest against it.
results.9-9: A celestial, fey, or similar creature gave me a blessing or revealed my secret origin.
results.10-10: Recruited into a lord’s army, I rose to leadership and was commended for my heroism.

Guild Business.name: Guild Business
Guild Business.description: Guilds are generally found in cities large enough to support several artisans practicing the same trade. However, your guild might instead be a loose network of artisans who each work in a different village within a larger realm. Work with your DM to determine the nature of your guild. You can select your guild business from the Guild Business table or roll randomly.

results.1-1: Alchemists and apothecaries
results.2-2: Armorers, locksmiths, and finesmiths
results.3-3: Brewers, distillers, and vintners
results.4-4: Calligraphers, scribes, and scriveners
results.5-5: Carpenters, roofers, and plasterers
results.6-6: Cartographers, surveyors, and chart-makers

Life of Seclusion.name: Life of Seclusion
Life of Seclusion.description: What was the reason for your isolation, and what changed to allow you to end your solitude? You can work with your DM to determine the exact nature of your seclusion, or you can choose or roll on the table below to determine the reason behind your seclusion.

results.1-1: I was searching for spiritual enlightenment.
results.2-2: I was partaking of communal living in accordance with the dictates of a religious order.
results.3-3: I was exiled for a crime I didn’t commit.
results.4-4: I retreated from society after a life-altering event.
results.5-5: I needed a quiet place to work on my art, literature, music, or manifesto.
results.6-6: I needed to commune with nature, far from civilization.
results.7-7: I was the caretaker of an ancient ruin or relic.
results.8-8: I was a pilgrim in search of a person, place, or relic of spiritual significance.

Origin.name: Origin
Origin.description: You’ve been to strange places and seen things that others cannot begin to fathom. Consider some of the distant lands you have visited, and how they impacted you. You can roll on the following table to determine your occupation during your time in the wild, or choose one that best fits your character.

results.1-1: Forester
results.2-2: Trapper
results.3-3: Homesteader
results.4-4: Guide
results.5-5: Exile or outcast
results.6-6: Bounty hunter

Specialty.name: Specialty
Specialty.description: During your time as a soldier, you had a specific role to play in your unit or army. Roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below to determine your role:

results.1-1: Officer
results.2-2: Scout
results.3-3: Infantry
results.4-4: Cavalry
results.5-5: Healer
results.6-6: Quartermaster
results.8-8: Support staff (cook, blacksmith, or the like)

A Dangerous Journey.name: A Dangerous Journey
A Dangerous Journey.text:
@Embed[JournalEntry.pbsoCh1ArtHandou.JournalEntryPage.MBogbj2CImVEJ7eM]

More than five hundred years ago, clans of dwarves and gnomes made an agreement known as the Phandelver Pact, by which they would share a rich mine in a wondrous cavern known as Wave Echo Cave. In addition to its mineral wealth, the mine contained great magical power. Human spellcasters allied themselves with dwarves and gnomes to channel and bind that energy into a great forge called the Forge of Spells, where magic items could be crafted. Times were good, and the nearby town of Phandalin prospered as well. But disaster struck when bandits swept through the North and laid waste to all in their path.

A powerful bandit force reinforced by evil mercenary wizards attacked Wave Echo Cave to seize its riches and magic treasures. Human wizards fought alongside their dwarf and gnome allies to defend the Forge of Spells, and the ensuing spell battle destroyed much of the cavern. Few survived the cave-ins and tremors, and knowledge of the location of Wave Echo Cave was lost.

For centuries, rumors of buried riches have attracted treasure seekers and opportunists to the area around Phandalin, but no one has located the lost mine. In recent years, people resettled the area, and Phandalin is now a rough-and-tumble frontier town.

Recently, a trio of dwarves—the Rockseeker brothers—discovered the entrance to Wave Echo Cave, and they intend to reopen the mines. Unfortunately for the Rockseekers, they aren’t the only ones interested in Wave Echo Cave. A mysterious villain known as the Spider controls a network of bandit gangs and goblin bands in the area, and his agents followed the Rockseekers to their prize. The Spider wants Wave Echo Cave for himself, and he’s taking steps to make sure no one else knows where it is.

Running This Chapter.name: Running This Chapter
Running This Chapter.text:
This chapter begins with a @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoGoblinAmbush]{goblin ambush} on the road to @UUID[JournalEntry.pbsoPhandalinVil]{Phandalin}, leaving it up to the characters to chase their attackers to a cave lair. Before getting into the adventure’s events, take a few minutes to do the following:

Character Introductions. Encourage the players to introduce their characters to each other if they haven’t done so already.

Connection to Gundren. Ask the players to think about how their characters came to know the dwarf @UUID[Actor.pbsoGundrenRocks]{Gundren Rockseeker}, if applicable. Let the players concoct their own stories. If a player is hard-pressed to think of anything, suggest something simple. For example, Gundren could be a childhood friend or someone who helped the player’s character escape a tough situation.
